name: shatteringly
content:
shatteringly adverb
(UPSETTING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes you feel extremely upset: She was suddenly and shatteringly rejected. They all turned against him including, most shatteringly, his youngest brother.
More examplesFewer examplesHis family called his death "shatteringly sad and utterly heartbreaking".In the final scene, the fate of his family is shatteringly resolved.

shatteringly adverb
(EXTREMELY)
in a very extreme way: The party has suffered a set of shatteringly bad results in the European elections. Why has it taken so long to come to this shatteringly obvious conclusion? a shatteringly loud noise
More examplesFewer examplesThe car is shatteringly fast.A long despairing cry rose from the back of his throat and screamed shatteringly across the hall.The shots were shatteringly loud at that short distance.

(especially of food) hard enough to be broken easily, or so hard that it breaks something: shatteringly crisp The best way to get shatteringly crisp chicken skin is to keep steam out of the oven. The sausages were tooth-shatteringly overcooked.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pastry is light, paper-thin, and fries up to a shatteringly crisp crunch.Tempura batter is all about texture, and should be light and shatteringly crisp.The thin, crinkly bean curd skin was shatteringly crisp.The caramel was tooth shatteringly hard when you bit into it.
